abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the First Structural Adjustment Credit
            (SAC- I) in Ethiopia. SAC-I was designed to support economic
            policy during the period in which Ethiopia went through a
            fundamental transformation from centralized planning to a
            market-based economy. The program consisted of two main
            components: (i) support for economic stabilization and (ii)
            support for the private sector. Bank performance in the
            identification of the program was highly satisfactory and
            consistent with the Government's policy as well as with
            the Bank's assistance strategy. One important lesson
            learned in this project is providing support and technical
            assistance for a new Borrower to learn the ropes on
            procurement and disbursement procedures. The overall
            performance under the SAC-I was found to be satisfactory.
            Efforts made to restore growth and stabilize the economy and
            the results thus obtained were encouraging. Moreover, the
            private sector has positively responded to the new
            investment Code. In particular, the targets for real
            economic growth, inflation rate, and fiscal balance had been attained.
